body.name: Montech Metal DT24 Premium, High Performance Dual-Tower CPU Cooler, with 2X Metal 120 PWM Fans, ARGB Aluminum Top Cover, 270W TDP - All Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs
features: Advanced Cooling: METAL DT24 Premium features a Dual Tower Design with six 6mm copper heat pipes for extensive heat dissipation. Enhanced fin design and dual fans maximize heat transfer and cooling efficiency, surpassing single-tower coolers.
Whisper-Quiet Efficiency: With high-density 104-layered heatsink fins and optimized spacing, this cooler maintains a noise level under 30dB(A) even at maximum fan speed.

Optimal Airflow: METAL 120 PWM fans feature a robust 6-pole motor, strengthened metal axial hub, HDB bearing, and double dynamic balance correction. This ensures high performance, extended lifespan, and low noise, all in one powerful fan.
Innovative Cooling: METAL DT24 features an expansive 8553.23cm² heat dissipation surface, efficiently spreading CPU heat. Enhanced by a dual fan system, it achieves optimal cooling efficiency.
Effortless Cooling: With an optimal heat dissipation surface area and a TDP of 270W, METAL DT24 ensures easy and efficient cooling for even the hottest CPUs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About MONTECH MONTECH was established by Telon in 2016, which focuses in the PC gaming market. MONTECH is quite successful in the Taiwanese market. It is now seeking to expand to the world. There are four pillars of our core values, we abbreviate them to four simple letters, SSEC. “Simplicity”, “Safety”, “Easy To Use” and “Customer-Trust”. SSEC is how we do everything, like designing products, manufacturing, communicating with customers, it is our deepest values here in Montech METAL DT24 PREMIUM Premium configuration for performance and Silence 2 high-performance METAL 120 PWM fansFunctions quietly. With only 30dB(A) at maximum fan speedCPU The heat produced by high-powered 12th Gen Intel processor can be dissipatedClassic and stylish lookingDiamond cut ARGB aluminum top coverAll black coating6 high-efficiency copper heat pipesInstalling RAM without CPU interference270W TDPEasy to install. Comes with brackets for the latest 1700 and AM5 models

This cooler is configured with 2 METAL 120 PWM fans, whose 6-pole motor and maximum static pressure fan blade design boost the ability of airflow, which flows through the heat sink. This optimal heat dissipation surface allows for the cooling of the hottest CPU to be easier and more efficient.

Six Heat pipes and Dual Tower Design Compared to single towers, Dual Tower coolers offer even larger heat dissipation surface area. The METAL DT24 Base utilizes six advanced 6mm copper heat pipes and combines them with a specialized fin design for better heat transfer capacity. The dual fan system also delivers increased airflow for the maximum in cooling efficiency. Advanced Engineering The METAL DT24 has an extra large combined heat dissipation surface area of 8553.23cm². This makes it extra efficient in spreading CPU heat to a large extended surface and even more efficiently cooled through the max airflow from it’s dual fan system. User-Friendly Installation To prevent loose and broken plastic brackets, our company uses all metal brackets. The bracket has undergone relentless tests by the MONTECH PRODUCT TEAM to build the easiest and safest CPU cooler bracket. Maximum Robust Airflow Within the two METAL 120 PWM fans core is a 6 pole motor, packed inside a strengthened metal axial hub, along with it’s HDB bearing and double dynamic balance correction process creates a fan that’s high performance, long lifetime and low noise all in one.
METAL DT24 PREMIUM METAL DT24 BASE Cooler ✓ ✓ ARGB Aluminum TOP Cover ✓ Mounting Kit ✓ ✓ Fans ✓ ✓ Thermal Paste ✓ ✓ Fan Buckle ✓ ✓ Low-noise Adaptors ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great so far
reviews.reviewText: My first PC build and it went surprisingly smooth. I'm using an I7 11700k, which can run hot at times (so I was told). I knew I was going to use an air cooler and found the price and power of the DT24 appealing. The large size concerned me a bit, but know I was going to use the Sky Two case (Montech as well) I knew they'd play well together. Extremely easy to install, had all the necessary brackets for the LGA 1200 (the fan came with the 1700 and AMD 4 & 5 as well). It's a big cooler and once I turned on the PC for the first time, everything was running full speed. Once I calibrated the fans in the bios, it was silent and cool. The only way I knew anything was on was seeing the fans spinning.Great combination with the Sky Two case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cools very well.
reviews.reviewText: The unit is solid and well made. Comes with all latest mounting hardware. For the price, it does well.I installed the base model on an AMD Ryzen 7900X. Under load those are claimed to jump right to 95C. I don't think I've ever seen it go over 85 with this cooler. (But I didn't do a full load until after I set the 135 Watt power mode in the BIOS.)Some people will like the extra RAM clearance. I personally will never buy RAM that needs it.I love that there's no RGB nonsense. I installed this in a case with a metal side panel. I'm never going to see the cooler anyway.For noise, I don't care. I've heard louder fans for sure. So it's probably good in that regard.Complaint: The mounting screws are needlessly too short. You have to push so much that you feel like you're going to break something, just to get them to the point where you can start to tighten them. I say needlessly because they have springs on them to even-out the pressure. Just make them longer and let the springs do their job.I did not use the supplied thermal paste. So I cannot comment on it's quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cools better than my old AOI
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Be aware that tall ram will interfere with the fan. I just mounted the fan about a half inch up fon the coller.
